title: ISSS608 Coursework
text: Welcome to Jia Rong’s ISSS608 Visual Analytics & Applications Coursework

title: About Me
text: Hi, I am Jia Rong. This website details my journey through the ISSS608 Visual Analytics and Applications course as part of my Master of IT in Business programme at SMU.

title: Hands-on Exercise 00: working with tidyverse
text:
Getting started

Loading tidyverse onto r environment by using the code chunk below.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)



Importing data

realis2019 <- read_csv('data/REALIS2019.csv')


popdata_fat <- read_csv('data/PopData2019_fat.csv')



Pivoting data

popdata_long <- popdata_fat %>% 
  pivot_longer(c(3:21),
               names_to = "Age Group",
               values_to = "Population")



Saving the data

write_rds(popdata_long, 'rds/popdata_long.rds')




Retrieving the rds files

working with dplyr

realis2019_selected <- realis2019 %>%
  select('Project Name',
         'Transacted Price ($)',
         'Type of Sale',
         'Unit Price ($ psm)',
         'Property Type')
realis2019_selected

# A tibble: 19,515 × 5
   `Project Name`     `Transacted Price ($)` `Type of Sale` `Unit Price ($ psm)`
   <chr>                               <dbl> <chr>                         <dbl>
 1 PEIRCE VIEW                        840000 Resale                         7434
 2 FLORIDA PARK                      3040000 Resale                         9737
 3 BULLION PARK                       860000 Resale                        11467
 4 CASTLE GREEN                      1000000 Resale                         9346
 5 HAPPY ESTATE                      7000000 Resale                        10183
 6 TEACHER'S HOUSING…                2880000 Resale                        12659
 7 THE PANORAMA                      1510000 Resale                        16064
 8 THE PANORAMA                       710000 Resale                        16905
 9 CHIP THYE GARDEN                  2800000 Resale                        13500
10 TEACHER'S HOUSING…                2300000 Resale                         9935
# ℹ 19,505 more rows
# ℹ 1 more variable: `Property Type` <chr>




working with filter() of dplyr.

realis2019_filtered <- realis2019_selected %>%
  filter(`Property Type` == 'Condominium'|
           `Property Type` == 'Apartment') %>%
  filter(`Type of Sale` == 'New Sale') %>%
  filter(`Unit Price ($ psm)` <= 13000)

title: Hands-on Exercise 00: working with tidyverse
text:
pacman::p_load(tidyverse)





realis2019 <- read_csv('data/REALIS2019.csv')


popdata_fat <- read_csv('data/PopData2019_fat.csv')





popdata_long <- popdata_fat %>% 
  pivot_longer(c(3:21),
               names_to = "Age Group",
               values_to = "Population")





write_rds(popdata_long, 'rds/popdata_long.rds')








realis2019_selected <- realis2019 %>%
  select('Project Name',
         'Transacted Price ($)',
         'Type of Sale',
         'Unit Price ($ psm)',
         'Property Type')
realis2019_selected

# A tibble: 19,515 × 5
   `Project Name`     `Transacted Price ($)` `Type of Sale` `Unit Price ($ psm)`
   <chr>                               <dbl> <chr>                         <dbl>
 1 PEIRCE VIEW                        840000 Resale                         7434
 2 FLORIDA PARK                      3040000 Resale                         9737
 3 BULLION PARK                       860000 Resale                        11467
 4 CASTLE GREEN                      1000000 Resale                         9346
 5 HAPPY ESTATE                      7000000 Resale                        10183
 6 TEACHER'S HOUSING…                2880000 Resale                        12659
 7 THE PANORAMA                      1510000 Resale                        16064
 8 THE PANORAMA                       710000 Resale                        16905
 9 CHIP THYE GARDEN                  2800000 Resale                        13500
10 TEACHER'S HOUSING…                2300000 Resale                         9935
# ℹ 19,505 more rows
# ℹ 1 more variable: `Property Type` <chr>






realis2019_filtered <- realis2019_selected %>%
  filter(`Property Type` == 'Condominium'|
           `Property Type` == 'Apartment') %>%
  filter(`Type of Sale` == 'New Sale') %>%
  filter(`Unit Price ($ psm)` <= 13000)

title: Hands-on Exercise 01: A Layered Grammar of Graphics - ggplot2 methods
text:
1 Overview
In this exercise, I will be exploring the basic principles and essential components of ggplot2 to plot statistical graphics based on the principle of Layered Grammar of Graphics.


2 Getting Started

Loading LibrariesImporting Dataset


We will load the tidyverse library

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)



In this exercise, we will be using the exam data

exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")






Show the code
pacman::p_load(tidyverse)
exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")
